Data: Ntini to Katich, no run length delivery through the corridor and Boucher gathers
Ntini to Katich, no run angling away from Katich who covers his off stump with his shuffle before letting the ball go through to the keeper
Ntini to Katich, no run fuller and in the same zone but Katich is not tempted

Ntini to Katich, no run loud shout for lbw but Bucknor is not impressed. They have gone for the review. What have we got here? A inside-edge! It landed in line with the stumps and straightened a bit, Katich came forward to defend and got a nice little edge on to the pad. It was hitting the stumps but Sout
Ntini to Katich, no run angling away from Katich who allows it to pass the off stump
Ntini to Katich, no run fullish and driven to covers

Steyn to Clarke, OUT Clarke has been cleaned up by Steyn. What an awesome delivery. It landed slightly short in length on the off stump line and straightened to hit the off. Clarke pushed inside the line and heard the death rattle.Not so awesome on replay. It was a very good delivery indeed but it landed
Steyn to Haddin, no run kicks up from short of length, Haddin hops to defend
Steyn to Haddin, no run gets behind the line to defend to the on side
Steyn to Haddin, no run outside off and Haddin allows it fly past the off stump
Steyn to Haddin, no run this one straightened from the off stump line but Haddin does well to cover the line to push the ball to Prince at mid-off
Steyn to Haddin, no run Three slips and gully watch as Haddin jumps to get on top of a lifting delivery from short of length and defend to the off side
Ntini to Katich, no run in the zone outside off stump and Katich does what he does: shuffle to off, cover the stumps and shoulder arms
Ntini to Katich, no run fuller but again slanting away from Katich who offers no shot
Ntini to Katich, 1 run full pitched around the off stump, pushed through cover point for a single
Ntini to Haddin, no run full in length, moving into off and middle line, Haddin gets forward to defend. The style of play there almost looked like Damien Martyn on that occasion.
Ntini to Haddin, no run cutting in to Haddin who goes back to push to the on side
Ntini to Haddin, no run full pitched, driven nicely but straight to the fielder on the off side

Steyn to Katich, FOUR runs inside-edge but it flies past the stumps. Full pitched, from round the stumps, and Katich went for the off drive but too much bottom hand shut the bat-face and he got a thick edge.
Steyn to Katich, no run still from round the stumps, hurls this one full and outside off, left alone
Steyn to Katich, (no ball) length delivery, pushed to mid-off
Steyn to Katich, no run leans across to place the ball to point region, bat away from the body
Steyn to Katich, no run homing in on the off stump, from that angle, Katich gets behind the line to offer the dead-bat
Steyn to Katich, FOUR runs from wide of the crease, he sends down a overpitched delivery and Katich has driven it through covers. Again lots of bottom-hand in that shot
Steyn to Katich, 1 run from over the stumps now, full pitched on the middle and leg, flicked through midwicket
Ntini to Katich, no run lands around the off stump, shapes away, left alone by the patient Katich
Ntini to Katich, no run similar delivery, same result
Ntini to Katich, no run And again.
Ntini to Katich, 1 run it was outside off, Katich squeezed it past square leg
Ntini to Haddin, no run coming in towards middle, Haddin pushes it to the on side
Ntini to Haddin, no run leans across to defend to the off side
Morkel to Katich, 1 run turned off the hips for a single
Morkel to Haddin, no run lands on a length outside off stump and moves away, left alone
Morkel to Haddin, FOUR runs banged in short and Haddin waited for the ball to arrive before pulling it front of square. He rolled his wrists and hit it straight to the ground
Morkel to Haddin, 4 leg byes drifts to the pads, Haddin misses the flick shot but it runs off the pad down to the fine-leg boundary
Morkel to Haddin, no run outside off stump, from slightly short of length and holding its line, left alone
Morkel to Haddin, FOUR runs well-timed square drive. It was full and wide no doubt but Haddin reached out to play a delicious drive
Ntini to Katich, FOUR runs short and wide, cut away to the point boundary. Ntini stands there for a while, mumbling to himself.

Ntini to Katich, no run Ntini switched to rounds-the-stumps attack. He gets this ball to dart back in from outside off but Katich lets it go after making sure it has not come back in line with the stumps
Ntini to Katich, no run this one moves in towards the off stump line, Katich goes back and across to push it to the on side
Ntini to Katich, no run leans forward to allow the ball to pass the off stump

Ntini to Katich, 3 runs full and well outside the off stump, Katich reaches out and drives -- too much bottom hand and he ends up dragging it through wide mid-off but has enough meat on it to send the ball almost to the boundary where Prince makes a sliding stop
Ntini to Haddin, no run from wide of the crease, moves in towards middle, Haddin gets back and across to defend to the off side
Morkel to Katich, no run short in length, around off, tapped towards mid-off
Morkel to Katich, no run short and lifting down leg, left alone
Morkel to Katich, no run just outside the off stump, Katich moves across to leave it alone
Morkel to Katich, no run bouncer but dug in too short and Katich has lots of time to duck
Morkel to Katich, no run full in length, moving away, Katich thought about leaving it, was late in withdrawing the bat and ended up sort of steering it to right of gully where a diving stop is made
Morkel to Katich, no run fuller, straighter, pushed to mid-off
Kallis to Haddin, no run length delivery outside off stump, Haddin allows it go through to Boucher
Kallis to Haddin, no run gets forward and across to leave another full-length delivery outside off

Kallis to Haddin, FOUR runs Fabulicious extra-cover drive, the most beautiful shot of the day. It was full in length and outside off stump, Haddin leaned across to cream it through the off side. Again, reminded a bit of Martyn there
Kallis to Haddin, no run leans across to push it to the off side
Kallis to Haddin, FOUR runs drifting in to the middle and leg line, Haddin got forward to wrist it to right of the diving mid-off fielder
Kallis to Haddin, no run mistimes the drive to the on side
Morkel to Katich, no run short in length and outside off stump line, left alone

Morkel to Katich, FOUR runs short and wide, Katich threw the kitchen sink at it .. Tell me isn't it difficult to thrown the kitchen sink actually? Do they mean like throwing the dirty utensils into the sink?
Morkel to Katich, no run full in outside off stump, left alone
Morkel to Katich, no run short in length, cutting away, left alone
Morkel to Katich, no run pushes it wide across Katich who leaves it for Boucher
Morkel to Katich, no run closer to the off stump but Katich seems to know where his off stump is.
Kallis to Haddin, no run short in length, stood up tall to punch it to covers
Kallis to Haddin, no run in the zone outside off stump, Haddin watches Boucher collect that
Kallis to Haddin, no run leans forward to drive to mid-off
Kallis to Haddin, no run outside off and left alone again. Haddin has moved to 16 and looking good so far
Kallis to Haddin, no run
Kallis to Haddin, no run over pitched outside off, dug out towards covers

Morkel to Katich, no run lands outside off stump, left alone by Katich. Left alone, allows it pass past the off stump, watches Boucher gather, lets it through to the keeper ... man i am running out of lines to write with our lovely patient Kato
Morkel to Katich, no run hmm looks he also ran out of patience on this occasion . He went for the cut outside off, it was not so short and he couldn't connect
Morkel to Katich, no run back to regular programming. Boucher collects.
Morkel to Katich, no run Boucher crouches to catch the ball in front of him as he shuffles to his left side!
Morkel to Katich, no run banged in short, Katich goes for the pull but misses and it goes down leg
Morkel to Katich, no run outside off stump, left alone
Kallis to Haddin, no run pitches back of a length and Haddin goes back to defend
Kallis to Haddin, 1 run bad ball, short and wide but Haddin cannot beat backward point
Kallis to Katich, no run well bowled, a clever little yorker which is jammed to midwicket
Kallis to Katich, no run pitches on a length and he gets right over it in watchful defence
Kallis to Katich, no run gently pitches on a length, just outside off stump, and shapes away but Katich shoulders arms contently
Kallis to Katich, no run pitches on middle and leg, straightens, Katich pats it back
Morkel to Haddin, FOUR runs overpitched on the stumps and thats not much more than a defensive push off the toes that beats mid-on quite comfortably
Morkel to Haddin, no run on the pads again and this time turned to midwicket
Morkel to Haddin, no run pitches back of a length and he gets back to defend to cover
Morkel to Haddin, no run gets tall and punches a good-looking shot off the back foot but Amla at cover times his dive to his right superbly and denies Haddin runs, good stuff there
Morkel to Haddin, no run another full one in the blockhole and Haddin digs it out in time
Morkel to Haddin, FOUR runs ah, close! Haddin chases a full, wide, swinging delivery and just spoons in in the air behind backward point to raise the 50-run stand, a loose shot but he survives

Harris to Katich, 1 run slip and short leg watch as Katich reaches his fifty with a little drive towards mid-off. He was in some trouble early on against Ntini but has hung around to graft another important fifty
Harris to Haddin, no run pushed to the on side of the pitch where Harris, the former Cricinfo diarist, makes a diving stop
Harris to Haddin, no run slightly short, cut away to point
Harris to Haddin, 1 run goes back to turn a delivery skidding in past square leg for a single
Harris to Katich, no run leans across to defend a flighted delivery outside off
Harris to Katich, no run flatter, pushed to the off side
Morkel to Haddin, FOUR runs lovely peachy drive. It was full in length and Haddin went through with the drive
Morkel to Haddin, no run pushed wide outside off stump, left alone
Morkel to Haddin, 1 run full in length and outside off, Haddin gets forward to drive to mid-off
Morkel to Katich, no run lands on a length around off stump, cuts away past Katich
Morkel to Katich, 1 run clipped through the on side to Amla at deep square leg region

Morkel to Haddin, no run length delivery on the off stump line, Haddin gets forward to push to the bowler who threatens to throw and Haddin turns back quickly but one minor detail- the ball slips out and rolls to the off side
Harris to Katich, no run goes right behind to work with the turn to midwicket
Harris to Katich, no run floated in the air outside off stump, square driven to point
Harris to Katich, 1 run leans forward to push to wide mid-off for a single
Harris to Haddin, no run leans forward to drive to mid-off
Harris to Haddin, no run skids on and Haddin goes back to push it down the track
Harris to Haddin, 1 run pretty full in length, squeezed wide of midwicket where Duminy makes a sliding stop
Kallis to Haddin, 1 run holds its line outside off after landing on a length and Haddin pushes it to cover point for a single
Kallis to Katich, no run leans forward to push a length delivery to the off side
Kallis to Katich, no run gets behind the line of a length delivery to push it to the on side of the pitch
Kallis to Katich, no run just outside off, stays in that region and Katich does his signature no shot
Kallis to Katich, no run cutting away from Katich and it bounces once before it reached Boucher.
Kallis to Katich, no run fuller, straighter, forcing Katich into playing a shot and he obliges with a defensive poke
Harris to Haddin, 2 runs drifts in from round the stumps, Haddin shapes to defend but it runs away off the inner edge to fine leg. Oohs and aahs from Harris
Harris to Haddin, 1 run flighted, slower through the air, clipped off the pads for a single
Harris to Katich, no run leans forward to defend down the pitch
Harris to Katich, no run flighted full, whipped to deepish midwicket, Haddin thinks about the single, Katich doesn't and he wins
Harris to Katich, no run on the off stump line, turning in, gets forward to defend
Harris to Katich, no run outside off stump, this one doesn't turn in, left alone
Kallis to Haddin, no run leans forward to drive to extra cover
Kallis to Haddin, no run
Kallis to Haddin, no run on a length, around the middle and off stump line, pushed past the bowler to mid-on
Kallis to Haddin, no run fuller, around the off stump, driven to the off side of the pitch where Kallis makes the stop
Kallis to Haddin, 1 run dips in late, towards middle and off, driven to mid-off where there is a fumble and Haddin picks up a single
Kallis to Katich, 3 runs drifts to the pads , overpitched as well, whipped through midwicket for three runs
Harris to Katich, no run leans forward to drive to mid-on
Harris to Katich, no run quicker, full again, just outside off stump, pushed towards covers
Harris to Katich, no run pushes towards Duminy at extra cover, they think about a run but kill the thought.
Harris to Katich, no run floated full outside off stump, driven hard but Duminy makes a diving stop to his left

Harris to Katich, OUT Kato is gone. The readers have woofed him out I think. What an uncharacteristic shot. It was on a length outside off stump, Katich dragged it from there, attempting a sweep shot but could only top edge it to close on the leg side and Imraan Khan takes his first Test catch. Remember h
Harris to Haddin, no run full, almost yorker length, dug out to the on side
Steyn to McDonald, 1 leg bye runs off the thigh pad to the on side
Steyn to Haddin, no run full pitched and driven superbly straight but oh boy too straight .. it cannons off the stumps at the other end.
Steyn to Haddin, no run cutting in towards middle, pushed towards mid-on, sets off for a run, McDonald responds but Haddin pulls out of the run.
Steyn to Haddin, no run length delivery outside off and Haddin doesn't let our dear readers miss Katich, lets it go through to Boucher
Steyn to Haddin, FOUR runs overpitched and straying on the pads, Haddin clips it away to deep square leg boundary. Again very nicely timed. He is playing a lovely little innings here.
Steyn to Haddin, no run shifts the line to middle and off, again driven well but straight to mid-on
Harris to McDonald, no run gets well forward to defend to the off side

Harris to McDonald, no run edged but not to the hands. It drifts in to beat the forward defensive poke and bobs away off bat and pad to right of Amla at short-leg who couldn't get a hand to it. It wasn't that far from him and there was a inside edge. Amla was slow to react. Where is David Boon, he would h
Harris to McDonald, no run leans forward to defend to the on side
Harris to McDonald, no run pushed through to mid-on

Harris to McDonald, no run another bat and pad but this one goes through silly mid-on. Again, it drifted in, McDonald was driving outside the line and it bobbed off the pad but went in front of the wicket
Harris to McDonald, no run leads forward to play an unconvincing push to the off side.
Steyn to Haddin, no run gets back to push it to the off side
Steyn to Haddin, no run loud shout for lbw but t'was too high. It cut in from outside off, Haddin was on the hop back and failed to connect with his defensive waft
Steyn to Haddin, 1 run another probing delivery, fuller and Haddin is late in getting his bat in front but manages to push the ball to the on side
Steyn to McDonald, no run on the front foot, defending to the on side
Steyn to McDonald, no run fuller but outside off stump, checking to see if McDonald has a brain freeze but everything is working there and he lets it go through to the keeper
Steyn to McDonald, no run aha! this one shaped in from outside off, McDonald shouldered arms and the ball rushed past the off stump
Harris to Haddin, no run on the middle stump line, defended to Amla who is now standing well forward, almost in front of Haddin, at short leg.
Harris to Haddin, no run tossed outside off, driven to mid-off
Harris to Haddin, no run drifts in towards the middle, nudged to short leg

Harris to Haddin, OUT Trapped in front but Haddin, after checking with the non-striker, has gone for the review. It landed on the middle stump line, skidded through quickly to rap him on the pad in front of middle and leg. That's dead duck. No inside edge and the height looks ok as well. Bucknor got it ri
Harris to Johnson, no run flighted outside off, doesn't turn in much and Johnson lets it go past the off stump
Harris to Johnson, no run on the off stump line, full, pushed to silly point
Steyn to McDonald, no run lifting delivery outside off stump and McDonald pulls his bat away from the line of the ball
Steyn to McDonald, no run in the channel outside off stump, McDonald has nothing to do with it

Steyn to McDonald, no run Ouch. It has crashed into the helmet. It was a snorter, coming in at McDonald who takes his eyes off the ball and just ducks his head and the ball hit him flush in the middle of the helmet.
Steyn to McDonald, 2 runs short in length, clipped off the pad past square leg
Steyn to McDonald, no run short-pitched delivery outside off stump, left alone ...
Steyn to McDonald, no run fuller, moving in, trying to trap him lbw but McDonald is upto the task, driving it back to Steyn
Harris to Johnson, no run goes back to nudge a short-of-length delivery to short leg
Harris to Johnson, no run turning in from outside off, a rather tentative poke from Johnson.
Harris to Johnson, no run again gets on the back foot to defend to the off side
Harris to Johnson, no run stretches forward this time to push to silly point
Harris to Johnson, 2 runs flighted on the middle, drifting towards middle and leg, whipped through midwicket for couple of runs
Harris to Johnson, no run flatter, lands on a length outside off and Johnson pushes it to cover point region
Steyn to McDonald, no run gets forward to defend to the off side. Steyn goes across to pick the ball up.
Steyn to McDonald, no run shaping in to McDonald who goes back to push it towards mid-on
Steyn to McDonald, no run full in length, holding its line outside off stump, McDonald thinks about playing a shot but decides to let it go
Steyn to McDonald, no run fuller but lands outside off and veers away further, easy decision to leave this time for McDonald
Steyn to McDonald, no run short in length, moving in to the off stump line, McDonald stands tall to get on top of it and defend towards mid-off
Steyn to McDonald, no run the bouncer arrives and its a good one too - on the middle stump line and McDonald does well to move towards the off stump to evade it
Harris to Johnson, no run gets back to drop the ball near his feet
Harris to Johnson, no run Harris is egging Johnson to hit. Flighted full, driven to Duminy at mid-off
Harris to Johnson, no run on the middle, spins in a bit, turned to short leg
Harris to Johnson, FOUR runs Johnson accepts the invitation finally. He got forward to loft a flighted delivery from outside off to the long-on boundary. We got a contest now.
Harris to Johnson, 1 run fuller but drifting towards the pads, tickled behind square for a single
Harris to McDonald, no run takes a couple of steps down the track and defends to the on side as Harris drags back the length
Steyn to Johnson, no run Cutting away from the short of length and bounces as well, Johnson shaped to play and is beaten as he withdraws his bat late
Steyn to Johnson, no run suddenly, this over, the back lift has got higher and pushed this one to the on side. Perhaps, Steyn will fire in a fuller one now
Steyn to Johnson, no run he does but overpitches it outside off and Johnson gets the bat down from that high back lift and drives pleasingly but straight to mid-off

Steyn to Johnson, no run short in length, cutting across from the leg stump line, pushed back to the bowler. Johnson then suggests that he should have pulled that one. Hmm... let's see what happens next ball. Will it be a yorker? or a bouncer?
Steyn to Johnson, no run It's a yorker and crashes into the pad before Johnson can get the bat down from that high back lift. Steyn turns around to appeal but it was missing leg stump.
Steyn to Johnson, FOUR runs thinks a yorker but serves a full toss on the off stump and Johnson plays a crisp off drive well to the left of mid-off
Harris to McDonald, 1 run flighted on the middle and leg, clipped past square leg
Harris to Johnson, no run gets forward to offer the dead-bat
Harris to Johnson, 1 run slows up the pace, tosses it up, Johnson is made to wait
Harris to McDonald, no run drifting in towards middle stump, pushed to the on side of the pitch
Harris to McDonald, no run slower through the air, flighted outside off, Harris jumps expecting a mistake but McDonald calmly pushes it to silly point
Harris to McDonald, no run leans forward to defend it down the track

Ntini to Johnson, no run full and it landed on the middle and off stump line before slanting away, Johnson takes the brave decision to let it go. That seemed a risky thing to do.. could have knocked out the off stump
Ntini to Johnson, 2 runs slightly short in length and on the middle and leg line and that length allows Johnson to get back and wrist it through wide mid-on
Ntini to Johnson, no run full pitched outside off, driven to mid-off
Ntini to Johnson, no run angled across Johnson who has a easier decision this time to let Boucher come into play
Ntini to Johnson, no run stands up tall to punch to mid-on
Ntini to Johnson, no run again close to the off stump and Johnson shoulders arms .. again seemed a tad close to leave
Harris to McDonald, no run on the off stump line, defended to the off side
Harris to McDonald, no run skids in to the middle, the arm-ball and again Harris jumps after delivery in expectation of a wicket, clipped to midwicket
Harris to McDonald, no run flighted, fuller, around off and middle, driven to mid-off
Harris to McDonald, 1 run a touch quicker but slightly shorter, McDonald gets back to work it past square leg
Harris to Johnson, no run turns in from outside off, from a length, Johnson doesn't offer a shot
Harris to Johnson, no run flighted fuller on the middle, Johnson waits before turning it to Imraan Khan at midwicket
Ntini to McDonald, no run shuffles outside off, exposing the sticks and defends the full delivery outside off to the off side.
Ntini to McDonald, no run again that walk across towards off - didn't notice it till this over - driven to covers
Ntini to McDonald, no run moves towards off stump, again exposing the stumps, almost daring Ntini to bowl it on middle and leg, flicked from off to midwicket
Ntini to McDonald, no run ends up outside off and Ntini fires in a bouncer and McDonald ducks
Ntini to McDonald, no run

Ntini to McDonald, FOUR runs edged but it drops short and rushes through between the diving Boucher and the lunging Kallis. He again shuffled outside off but Ntini kept it just outside off to induce the edge. It didn't carry to Boucher who flung himself to his right
Harris to Johnson, no run stays back to punch a delivery turning in to covers
Harris to Johnson, no run on the middle and off stump line, defended down the track
Harris to Johnson, no run beaten by the one that didn't turn in. It was flighted nicely outside off, drawing Johnson forward and he ends up pushing inside the line
Harris to Johnson, no run fuller, straighter, driven to mid-off
Harris to Johnson, no run on the middle, worked towards midwicket
Harris to Johnson, no run floated outside off, driven to right of cover where Prince makes a fine stop
Ntini to McDonald, no run walk walk walk towards the off stump and defends a length delivery outside off

Ntini to McDonald, 3 runs he makes that technique work for him this time. He stands with his bat on the off stump line, shuffles to outside off and works a full pitched delivery from outside off through wide mid-on region
Ntini to Johnson, no run bounces away as it slants across Johnson who decides to leave it
Ntini to Johnson, no run fuller, on the middle stump line, defended to the on side
Ntini to Johnson, no run gets behind the line to defend to the off side
Ntini to Johnson, FOUR runs Shot! It was short in length and outside off and Johnson punched on the up and through the line and the ball sped away through wide mid-off region
Harris to McDonald, 1 run flighted on the leg stump line, turned towards wide midwicket region
Harris to Johnson, no run slow through the air, nicely tossed up, Johnson is made to wait on the front foot and he defends to the on side
Harris to Johnson, no run again slower, slightly short in length and Johnson tries to whip that length away but is early into the shot and it hits him high on the thigh pad
Harris to Johnson, 1 run leans forward to drive wide of mid-off for a single
Harris to McDonald, 1 run flighted on the middle stump line, on driven towards mid-on for a single
Harris to Johnson, no run beaten again by the one that doesn't spin in. He leaned forward to defend but the bat went inside the line as the ball tailed past the off stump
Ntini to McDonald, no run walks outside off and shoulders arms
Ntini to McDonald, no run shuffles right outside off and Ntini ends up pushing it wide outside off

Ntini to McDonald, OUT Ntini's patience has paid off. McDonald walked across outside off again. Ntini kept it full and even further outside off. McDonald went for the cover drive but edged it into the bucket hands of Kallis at first slip.
Ntini to Siddle, no run in the outside off stump channel and left alone

Ntini to Siddle, OUT Ntini takes out Siddle. He straightens a length delivery outside off and Siddle lunges forward to stab it to left of second slip where AB swallows it. Out for a duck. Eight for 190.
Ntini to McGain, no run edged again but falls short of second slip. Similar delivery and another jab but this one rolls away to AB
Harris to Johnson, no run leans forward to defend down the pitch
Harris to Johnson, no run turns in from outside off stump, defended off the back foot
Harris to Johnson, FOUR runs Johnson opens his shoulders. Flighted outside off and Johnson swings it over wide midwicket. Here we go. Will he keep going after Harris? Will Harris get him?
Harris to Johnson, 1 run he steps down the track, Harris remains calm and slows it up further and Johnson is early into his swing and ends up dragging it to Imraan at deep midwicket
Harris to McGain, no run just outside off stump, defended to silly point. Watch out for the arm-ball
Harris to McGain, 1 run drags this one short and is lapped around the corner past square leg to get his first runs in Test cricket.
Ntini to McGain, no run short in length and outside off, dabbed to right of third slip where Prince makes a neat diving stop
Ntini to McGain, no run just outside off stump, rushing past the defensive poke
Ntini to McGain, no run full in length and outside off, McGain tries to play a defensive shot but it has gone past the outside edge
Ntini to McGain, 1 run fires in a yorker on the off stump, McGain manages to hold his balance, crouches to dig it out close on the off side and they rush across for a single
Ntini to Johnson, no run full pitched around off stump, driven cleanly but can't beat mid-off
Ntini to Johnson, 2 runs length delivery around the off stump, Mitch swats it across the line and through wide midwicket
Harris to McGain, no run quicker, flatter, short in length, McGain goes right back to defend to short leg
Harris to McGain, no run fuller, bit more air, driven to the off side of the pitch
Harris to McGain, 1 leg bye drifts towards the pad, rolls away to fine leg
Harris to Johnson, FOUR runs drags this short and Mitch hangs on the back foot to pull it away with contempt.

Harris to Johnson, 1 run dropped by Imraan Khan at deep midwicket. What a mess. Harris had dragged back the length after seeing Johnson advance and it was swung straight to Imraan who didn't judge it all all. He seemed to be going back instead of taking couple of steps forward. He realised his mistake and
Harris to McGain, no run leans forward to defend
Steyn to Johnson, FOUR runs Superb shot to welcome Steyn. It was full and Johnson thrust his front foot out to slam it between the bowler and mid-on

Steyn to Johnson, no run shorter in length, cutting across Johnson who pushes it to cover point and there is a confusion between the two about the single. Johnson walks over to have a chat with McGain

Steyn to Johnson, OUT Mitch is gone, going for a six. It was a length delivery and a tad slower as well and Johnson got under the ball more than he wanted and got elevation instead of distance. Prince ran to his left from long-on to hold on to the ball. Nine down.
Steyn to McGain, no run short and wide outside off, McGain thinks about having a dab but decides against it
Steyn to McGain, no run short in length and holding its line outside off stump, McGain pushes inside the line and is beaten comprehensively
Steyn to McGain, OUT 209 all out. Full and straight outside off, McGain is caught at the crease and hangs his bat out and stabs it to third slip.
Good disciplined show from South Africa to bowl out Australia for 209. How will their batsmen go about their task? Remember, they have new openers. Join us in a short while for the reply.
Siddle to Kallis, no run cutting in from outside off stump, from back of length, Kallis gets back and across to push it to mid-off

Siddle to Kallis, 1 run He has reached his ton after a 11-month gap. Oh no the umpire has signalled it as leg bye! Kallis was celebrating already . What drama. He moved back and across and tried to work it to the on side and got a inside edge to his pad and it rolled off the off side. Kallis had pumped hi
Siddle to de Villiers, no run outside the off stump
Siddle to de Villiers, no run
Siddle to de Villiers, 2 runs short of length, clipped off the pads
Siddle to de Villiers, no run
Hilfenhaus to Kallis, no run short in length, hops to punch it to the off side
Hilfenhaus to Kallis, no run full in length, outside the off stump, left alone
Hilfenhaus to Kallis, no run short in length outside off, pulled away to Katich at square leg
Hilfenhaus to Kallis, no run overpitched well outside off stump, left alone

Hilfenhaus to Kallis, 1 run full pitched outside off stump and square driven through cover point and the crowd roar again!! good fun. They are making sure that Kallis has got that hundred in case that decision is reversed again to leg bye!
Hilfenhaus to de Villiers, no run leans forward to defend
Siddle to Kallis, no run back of length, jumps outside off, steered to point region
Siddle to Kallis, no run leans forward to drive to the off side
Siddle to Kallis, no run moving in to the middle stump, pushed to mid-on
Siddle to Kallis, no run gets across to open the bat face and push it to the off side
Siddle to Kallis, no run the slower one, Kallis gets forward to play a very solid defensive stroke
Siddle to Kallis, no run full in length and outside off, left alone
McGain to de Villiers, no run leans forward to push a flighted delivery to backward point

McGain to de Villiers, SIX runs We got a man down in the crowd! It was a dolly, a long hop and de Villiers pulls it over midwicket boundary where a man lunges over the railings to catch it and topples over !
McGain to de Villiers, 1 run clipped off the legs to the long-leg region. 100 up for McGain. This is the worst economy rate in Test history.
McGain to Kallis, 1 run leans forward to drive to mid-off
McGain to de Villiers, no run goes right back to defend to the off side
McGain to de Villiers, 1 run flighted full on the off stump line, squeezed through cover point.
Hilfenhaus to de Villiers, 2 runs starts the day with a lovely cover drive. He glided forward smoothly to caress it through the off-side field
Hilfenhaus to de Villiers, 2 runs busy start
Hilfenhaus to de Villiers, 3 runs And it keeps coming. It was short in length and de Villiers pulls it over midwicket
Hilfenhaus to Kallis, no run curving away from the off stump, left alone
Hilfenhaus to Kallis, no run in the corridor outside off and Kallis covers his off stump before shouldering arms
Hilfenhaus to Kallis, no run on the middle stump line, Kallis pushes it to Mitchell Johnson at mid-on
Siddle to de Villiers, no run full pitched delivery around off stump, pushed to mid-on
Siddle to de Villiers, no run length delivery outside off stump, de Villiers shuffles across to steer it to backward point
Siddle to de Villiers, 2 runs well up on the middle, drifting in and de Villiers flicks it away between deep square leg and deep backward square leg fielder
Siddle to de Villiers, no run from wide of the crease, on a length outside off ,stands up tall to punch it to covers
Siddle to de Villiers, 1 run leans forward to defend the full-length delivery to cover point
Siddle to Kallis, no run shapes in a touch from the off stump line, goes back to push it to the off side
Hilfenhaus to de Villiers, 1 run gets his fifty with a dab through midwicket. 18th Test fifty.
Hilfenhaus to Kallis, no run gets back to defend down the track

Hilfenhaus to Kallis, OUT Kallis goes without adding a run today. It was short in length on the middle, straightened and must have stopped on him a bit, Kallis was shaping to short-arm pull it to the on side and ended up checking the shot and edging the ball straight up and Hilfenhaus strolls forward to
Hilfenhaus to Duminy, no run bangs in a bouncer, high and Duminy ducks
Hilfenhaus to Duminy, no run another bouncer and Duminy goes down under again
Hilfenhaus to Duminy, no run hattrick of bouncers and Duminy gets under it quickly. This one was on the middle stump line
Siddle to de Villiers, 2 runs short in length, cutting in from outside off stump, whipped past square leg for couple of runs
Siddle to de Villiers, no run full in length, outside off, de Villiers shuffles across and lets it pass the off stump
Siddle to de Villiers, 1 run back of length, moving in towards off and middle, de Villiers goes back to turn it to the on side for a single
Siddle to Duminy, no run back of length, coming in from outside leg, Duminy clips it away to the on side, looking for a single, but Katich stops it at short leg.
Siddle to Duminy, no run similar delivery, perhaps moving in a bit more and Duminy taps it to the off side
Siddle to Duminy, no run slanted across the off stump, left alone, swings away after it crosses the stumps - posthumous swing - and Haddin makes a tumbling stop
Hilfenhaus to de Villiers, no run shuffles right across to cover the off stump to leave a delivery go through to Haddin
Hilfenhaus to de Villiers, 1 run short in length and curving away outside off, de Villiers moved across, got close to the ball and dragged it from there through midwicket
Hilfenhaus to Duminy, no run in the channel outside off, left alone
Hilfenhaus to Duminy, no run dug in short on the middle and leg line, Duminy hops across, tries to clip it away but gets in a tangle and the ball bounds away off the thigh pad
Hilfenhaus to Duminy, no run almost a action replay there .. they are trying to fend a short delivery to hands
Hilfenhaus to Duminy, no run full and outside off, left alone
Siddle to de Villiers, no run full in length and outside off, left alone
Siddle to de Villiers, no run full pitched stuff, driven back down the pitch
Siddle to de Villiers, no run length delivery outside off, left alone
Siddle to de Villiers, no run moves right across to get behind a short-of-length delivery on the off stump line and pushes it to the off side
Siddle to de Villiers, no run leans well forward to defend to coves
Siddle to de Villiers, no run full but a tad too wide outside off to interest de Villiers
Hilfenhaus to Duminy, no run bouncer banged in on middle, Duminy spotted it early and ducked well under it
Hilfenhaus to Duminy, no run back of a length on the off stump, jumps up to Duminy who handles it well, dropping it with soft hands into the off side

Hilfenhaus to Duminy, no run bouncer again and was tested this time, didn't anticipate it, short on middle and off and he just managed it evade it at the last moment, Haddin collects it well over his head
Hilfenhaus to Duminy, 1 run some relief finally, good length on the off stump, dropped into the off side well short of point for a quick single
Hilfenhaus to de Villiers, no run testing line on middle and off, defended solidly off the back foot
Hilfenhaus to de Villiers, 1 run short of a length outside off, chopped down between cover and point for a single
Johnson to de Villiers, no run not immediately, short of a length on the off stump, stand stall and defends it on the pitch
Johnson to de Villiers, 1 run back of a length again, much straighter though, turned away behind square for a single
Johnson to Duminy, 1 run fuller but wrong line, straying on the pads, flicked straight to short leg where a fumble allows them to sneak a single
Johnson to de Villiers, 1 run short of a good length on the off stump, has no trouble closing the face and turning it away wide of midwicket, easily done
Johnson to Duminy, no run short of a length on the off stump, punched into the off side towards cover
Johnson to Duminy, no run a touch fuller on middle, tries to work it away behind square, is struck on the thighs
Hilfenhaus to de Villiers, no run fullish on middle and off, defended solidly back to the bowler, de Villiers looking very composed here
Hilfenhaus to de Villiers, no run held it back just a touch but the batsman adjusted to the length well, presenting the full face and playing it back to Hilfy
Hilfenhaus to de Villiers, 2 runs came back in this time, covered the movement well by getting across and clipping it away behind square
Hilfenhaus to de Villiers, no run held its line this time, good length outside off, de Villiers lets it go

Hilfenhaus to de Villiers, no run plays and misses, much fuller, overpitched outside off stump, goes for a blazing drive through the covers but if he sees the replays he'll find he was nowhere near it
Hilfenhaus to de Villiers, 1 run well played, fullish on the off stump, dropped into the off side between point and cover for a quick single
Johnson to de Villiers, no run leans forward to play a defensive shot
Johnson to de Villiers, no run angled across de Villiers who lets it fly past him
Johnson to de Villiers, no run length delivery around the off stump, de Villiers thought of leaving it first, then stabbed it off the inner edge to the pad
Johnson to de Villiers, no run gets forward to defend a length delivery to covers

Johnson to de Villiers, FOUR runs bit of extra bounce from short of length, de Villiers shaped to defend and it went off the shoulder of the bat between slip cordon and gully. AB played with soft hands there
Johnson to de Villiers, no run moving across AB who lets it go past him
Hilfenhaus to Duminy, 5 wide Very high bouncer, harmless for the batsman but a nuisance for Haddin who can't reach it
Hilfenhaus to Duminy, no run another bouncer and Duminy ducks
Hilfenhaus to Duminy, 1 run short in length, hops to push it close on the off side and they rush across for a quick single
Hilfenhaus to de Villiers, no run back of length, holding its line outside off, de Villiers ends up outside off and defends to the off side off the pitch
Hilfenhaus to de Villiers, no run beaten outside off. Fuller and again holding its line outside off, de Villiers shuffles across, ends up outside off again and has a poke before withdrawing his bat
Hilfenhaus to de Villiers, 2 runs turns it off his hips past square leg for couple of runs
Hilfenhaus to de Villiers, no run leans forward to defend a length delivery to the off side
Johnson to Duminy, FOUR runs short in length outside off and Duminy goes back to play a lovely punchy drive through cover point. Johnson has now given over 100 runs
Johnson to Boucher, no run leans forward to defend
Johnson to Boucher, no run angled across , left alone
Johnson to Boucher, no run jumps in with bounce, hit on the thigh pad
Johnson to Boucher, no run leans forward to defend to the off side
Siddle to de Villiers, no run full in length outside off stump, left alone
Siddle to de Villiers, FOUR runs fuller, outside off stump and de Villiers gets across, opens the bat-face and runs it, along the ground, past Ponting at second slip.
Siddle to de Villiers, no run short in length, cutting in towards off and middle, defended to the on side of the pitch
Siddle to de Villiers, no run leans forward to defend
Siddle to de Villiers, 1 run short in length, stops a bit and mistimes the cut shot to extra cover
Siddle to Boucher, no run full and outside off stump, Boucher thinks about having a dab but changes his mind
Johnson to de Villiers, no run yorker length but outside off stump, dug out to the off side and Johnson gets across to pick the ball
Johnson to de Villiers, no run lands on a length around the off stump, moves away, AB covers his off stump before shouldering arms
Johnson to de Villiers, 1 run drifts on to the pads, tickled away to Siddle at fine leg
Johnson to Boucher, no run full and moving across Boucher who lets his counterpart do the job
Johnson to Boucher, no run closer to the off stump but remains outside off and Haddin collects
Johnson to Boucher, no run moves back and across to leave a back-of-length delivery outside off
Siddle to de Villiers, 1 run full pitched outside off stump, driven to sweeper cover for a single. 450 up and the lead is 241
Siddle to Boucher, no run short in length, in the corridor outside off, tilts in but not enough to make Boucher play
Siddle to Boucher, no run dug in short outside off, Boucher gets back to try and force it through the off side but the bounce is too high for him and he knocks the ball down to covers
Siddle to Boucher, no run super delivery. It jags back in sharply with bounce to beat the defensive prod and hits him high on the thigh pad. Siddle has bowled his heart out without much reward.

Siddle to Boucher, 1 bye gets this to straighten outside off stump and Bad Hands days of Brad Haddin returns. He doesn't take it cleanly and this is no 53, the highest no of extras Australia have ever conceded in a Test.
Siddle to de Villiers, no run shapes to defend and the ball clips the inner edge and rolls away to the off side
Johnson to Boucher, no run gets back to defend to the on side
Johnson to Boucher, FOUR runs banged in short, on the off stump line, Boucher plays a neat short-arm jab pull to deep square leg boundary
Johnson to Boucher, no run gets on his toes to get on top of the bounce and defends to the off side
Johnson to Boucher, no run
Johnson to Boucher, no run well-directed bouncer, perfume ball, rushing past the face and Boucher sways away at the last moment

Johnson to Boucher, no run Boucher has been given out caught behind and he goes for the review It was full delivery slanted across Boucher who had a poke at it. It doesn't seem to have taken the edge. The bat hit the front boot and that was the noise. Let's see what decision they take. Bucknor says not o
Siddle to de Villiers, 1 run pushes it behind square leg for a single
Siddle to Boucher, no run pushed well outside the off stump , left alone
Siddle to Boucher, no run short and wide outside off, left alone
Siddle to Boucher, no run short delivery outside off, Boucher went for the cut but the ball bounced over the blade and Siddle is not impressed
Siddle to Boucher, no run lovely probing delivery, change of length from Siddle
Johnson to de Villiers, 2 runs back of length around the off stump line, de Villiers, as he has done through his stay, gets across to clip it through the on side

Johnson to de Villiers, no run banged in short on the leg and middle line, AB shuffles across, decides late to go for the short-arm pull and it bounds away off the body one bounce to Haddin down the leg side
Johnson to de Villiers, 1 run another short delivery, this time AB makes contact but straight to Hughes at deep backward square leg

Johnson to Boucher, FOUR runs edged but flies through the gap between second slip and gully. Boucher played away from the body as he chased the full delivery slanted across him and got a nice profitable edge. It was the typical Johnson delivery- full and outside off stump
Johnson to Boucher, no run similar delivery and this time Boucher decides to leave it

Johnson to Boucher, OUT Caught at second slip. Poor stuff from Boucher. He had just edged one through the cordon and he goes hard at another full delivery slanting across him. Edge and gone! Australia have done well today to take out three wickets.
Siddle to de Villiers, no run full in length and outside off stump, left alone
Siddle to de Villiers, no run kicks up from short of length outside off, AB shuffles across to defend and finds the inside edge to his pad
Siddle to de Villiers, no run further outside off to compensate AB's shuffle but he decides to leave this one
Siddle to de Villiers, no run fuller, closer to the off stump, no shuffle from AB this time
Siddle to de Villiers, no run from wide of the crease, a full and wide delivery outside off, left alone
Siddle to de Villiers, no run short in length outside off stump, mistimes a punchy stroke to covers
Johnson to Morkel, no run from a round-armish action, full and skidding outside off stump, left alone
Johnson to Morkel, 3 runs full pitched on the middle stump line, Albie leans forward to whip it through midwicket to make his first Test runs
Johnson to de Villiers, no run lands on a length around off, moves away, AB shuffles right across to get outside off stump and defends to Clarke at extra cover
Johnson to de Villiers, 2 runs short delivery and AB plays a nonchalant pull shot in front of square leg and the deep backward square leg fielder Hughes comes around to make the stop

Johnson to de Villiers, no run from that round-arm action this time, full and just outside off stump, AB was shaping to play a flamboyant shot through the off side, realises he can't play that as the ball has really cramped him up and gets out of the corner with a little dab shot
Johnson to de Villiers, no run goes back to defend a back-of-length delivery down the pitch
Siddle to Morkel, no run bouncer on the leg side, left alone
Siddle to Morkel, no run short in length, punched to the off side
Siddle to Morkel, no run stands up tall to push a short-of-length delivery to the off side
Siddle to Morkel, 1 run on a length, moving in to middle and off, worked to square leg
Siddle to de Villiers, no run short in length and outside off stump, left alone
Siddle to de Villiers, no run short in length and well outside off stump, de Villiers moves back and across towards the off stump but mistimes the shot to covers
Johnson to Morkel, FOUR runs sharp bouncer, Albie is late in reacting but manages to yank away his head and gets the bat in front of the chest and guides the ball between gully and slip cordon

Johnson to Morkel, no run Johnson repeats the does and hits Albie on his gloves on the bottom-hand which is taken off the handle post the impact .. the ball rolls away to the off side. No short leg yet but third slip moves in
Johnson to Morkel, 1 run gets off the strike with a dab shot, off a length delivery, to extra cover
Johnson to de Villiers, FOUR runs trying to make use of the AB shuffle, Mitch sends this on the leg stump line, AB holds his balance while on the move to glance it to the boundary

Johnson to de Villiers, no run Loud loud shout for lbw as Johnson gets his man on the shuffle. Bucknor says not out and Ponting doesn't go the review. It landed on length around the middle stump and straightened to hit the pad. No replays yet. There might have been an inside edge
Johnson to de Villiers, no run outside off stump, left alone
Hilfenhaus to Morkel, 1 leg bye fullish, tires to flick it and it rolls off the pad to square leg

Hilfenhaus to de Villiers, no run short in length outside off stump, tries to use his wrists and work it to the on side but edges it .. he then suggests he should have punched it through the off side.
Hilfenhaus to de Villiers, 2 runs goes back and across to tap it through backward point
Hilfenhaus to de Villiers, no run moves across, covers the off stump and shoulders arms
Hilfenhaus to de Villiers, no run curving away from the off stump, shuffles across to outside off, gets squared up as the ball curves away but manages to pat it towards covers
Hilfenhaus to de Villiers, no run leans across to defend to point region
McGain to Morkel, no run flighted full outside off, Albie shapes to drive but the bat face shuts and edges the ball to his pad
McGain to Morkel, no run leans across to defend to the off side
McGain to Morkel, no run flighted across outside off stump, squeezed to backward point
McGain to Morkel, 1 run short delivery outside off stump, cut away hard but there is a sweeper cover to cover it
McGain to de Villiers, no run leans forward to defend a flighted length delivery on the middle and leg line
McGain to de Villiers, FOUR runs AB moves to 89 with a pull. It was the long hop, gift-wrapped by McGain and AB rips it open with a pull to the cowcorner
Hilfenhaus to Morkel, no run stands up tall to covers
Hilfenhaus to Morkel, FOUR runs what a skilful pull shot! It was bouncing at his face, Albie hopped to unfurl a wristy pull to dismiss it
Hilfenhaus to Morkel, no run
Hilfenhaus to Morkel, FOUR runs short, too short and it sits up nicely for Albie to pull it through midwicket. That was a lot easier shot to play.
Hilfenhaus to Morkel, no run stands up tall as he goes back to push it to mid-off
Hilfenhaus to Morkel, no run short in length, outside off stump, Albie moves back to punch to mid-off
McGain to de Villiers, 1 run goes back to punch the ball to sweeper cover
McGain to Morkel, no run quicker, turns in, goes back to deflect it to the on side
McGain to Morkel, no run comes down the track for the big heave but is beaten by the dip there and ends up mistiming it back to the bowler
McGain to Morkel, no run flatter trajectory, pushed to Ponting at silly point
McGain to Morkel, FOUR runs flighted full and Albie advances down the track to drill it past the non-striker. That almost crashed against AB's bat at the other end
McGain to Morkel, 1 run goes for another drive but mistimes the off drive to left of mid-off for a single
Hilfenhaus to Morkel, no run leans forward to push to mid-off
Hilfenhaus to Morkel, FOUR runs short in length and well outside off, Albie goes back to crack it past backward point. The crowd love it. Albie is motoring along nicely here.
Hilfenhaus to Morkel, no run Hilfy comes back with a nice shapely delivery outside off stump and Albie hangs his bat out away from the body and is beaten
Hilfenhaus to Morkel, no run pushes it across Albie who watches Haddin take it
Hilfenhaus to Morkel, no run gets forward to push-drive a length delivery to mid-off
Hilfenhaus to Morkel, no run pushed to the off side. That's lunch.
McGain to de Villiers, no run goes right back to guide a slow leg break to backward point.
McGain to de Villiers, FOUR runs Ah he made it look very easy. Flighted outside off and AB leaned forward into the off drive and got it wide of mid-off
McGain to de Villiers, 1 run short delivery and wide outside off, cut away to Hughes at sweeper cover
McGain to Morkel, no run slip and short leg watch as Albie defends a delivery from round the stumps to the off side
McGain to Morkel, no run flighted into the rough, whatever that has been created, driven to mid-off
McGain to Morkel, no run flighted outside off, thrashed to covers
McDonald to de Villiers, 2 runs full pitched outside off stump, driven through cover
McDonald to de Villiers, no run full pitched on the off and middle, mistimes the drive to short midwicket

McDonald to de Villiers, 1 run ooh nervy nervy there .. floated full on the middle and leg line, AB tries to whip it across and gets a leading edge as the ball cuts away and past the slip to third man
McDonald to Morkel, no run from round the stumps, full and outside off, left alone
McDonald to Morkel, no run yorker from round the stumps, keeps coming in from the wide angle, Albie arrests the front foot movement,gets his bat down to dig it out
McDonald to Morkel, no run almost dragged on. Full and outside off, Albie goes for the big booming drive through extra cover and edges it to his back pad ..

McGain to de Villiers, 2 runs That's his 9th Test ton and third hundred in this six-Test series of games against Australia. He drove to left of sweeper cover and came back for his hundred. Crowd lap it up and so do his team-mates in the pavilion.
McGain to de Villiers, 1 run drifting towards hips, nurdled around the corner, behind square for a single
McGain to Morkel, no run turns in from round the stumps, struck on the pad outside off stump while leaning across to defend
McGain to Morkel, no run stretches well forward to defend
McGain to Morkel, no run more turn from the rough, Albie goes back to work it to Ponting at midwicket

McGain to Morkel, SIX runs Flighted up, aiming for the rough but Albie waltzes down the track to the pitch of the ball and swings it high and long over long-on into the delirious crowd. Well .. I expect them to be delirious. Albie's first Test six.
McDonald to de Villiers, 1 run gets forward to nudge to cover point for a single
McDonald to Morkel, no run coming in from round the stump and the left-handed Albie pushes it to extra cover
McDonald to Morkel, FOUR runs from wide of the crease, from round the stumps and Albie drives on a bent knee well clear of mid-off. Eye-catching stroke.
McDonald to Morkel, 1 run full pitched outside off and he has another go at it but Hughes dives to his right at extra cover to make a half-stop
McDonald to de Villiers, no run drifts to the pads, tries to flick, misses and is struck on the pad
McDonald to de Villiers, no run length delivery on the middle, straightening a touch, defended to the on side
McGain to Morkel, 2 runs lands short in length, wary of Albie's charge down the track, turns towards pads, glided to fine-leg region
McGain to Morkel, FOUR runs McGain continues to bleed. He flighted it outside off and Albie smoked it over mid-off
McGain to Morkel, no run leans forward to defend, struck on the pad, just outside off stump I reckon
McGain to Morkel, no run lands well outside off stump, turns in and Haddin collects
McGain to Morkel, 1 run short in length, turning in, punched to right of covers where McDonald makes the diving stop
McGain to de Villiers, no run the quickish flatter slider on the middle and leg, AB stays adjacent to the line to punch it away
McDonald to Morkel, no run length delivery around the off stump, pushed to covers
McDonald to Morkel, no run on a length, sliding away, pushed to the off side.
McDonald to Morkel, FOUR runs drops it short and Albie cuts it to left of backward point and has quickly moved to 49
McDonald to Morkel, no run fuller, on the leg and middle, worked to midwicket . SA lead by 333 runs
McDonald to Morkel, no run on a length, just outside off stump, guided to backward point
McDonald to Morkel, no run on a length, just outside off stump, guided to backward point
McGain to de Villiers, 1 run gets forward to drive to Hughes at deep cover
McGain to Morkel, no run from round the stumps to the left-handed Albie who goes back to push it to cover
McGain to Morkel, no run slower outside off , tapped to point region.
McGain to Morkel, no run shorter, flatter outside off, Albie goes back, cuts but straight to Hussey at point

McGain to Morkel, 1 run tossed up outside off stump and Albie runs down the track to push it wide of mid-off to bring up his 50 on debut. Mornie, his brother, leads the celebration in the dressing room
McGain to de Villiers, 1 run stays round the stumps for AB who skips down the track and cracks the full toss to deep midwicket
Siddle to de Villiers, 1 run drifting in full towards off stump line, square driven to sweeper on the off side. Clarke is the fielder there

Siddle to Morkel, FOUR runs goes round the stumps to Albie who continues to make merry. It was slightly short in length and Albie cuts straight to the ground and it bounces over Hughes at point and runs away to the boundary
Siddle to Morkel, FOUR runs he likes to cut but also loves to drive. Full pitched outside off and Albie creams it wide of mid-off for another boundary
Siddle to Morkel, no run yorker from round the stumps, going down leg and hits the pad and rolls away to the off side

Siddle to Morkel, no run length delivery coming in towards middle, Albie rushes back and brings his bat in line to defend to the on side. Haddin was briefly interested, thinking the ball might get through the defenses
Siddle to Morkel, no run full and moving down leg, Albie tries to whip it away, misses and the ball crashes into the pad
McGain to de Villiers, no run from round the stumps to AB who goes for the sweep but can't connect
McGain to de Villiers, SIX runs Sweet. Down the track and lifts it cleanly over mid-on and it keeps flying and is sucked over long-on by screaming fans.
McGain to de Villiers, no run stays adjacent to drive inside out to cover
McGain to de Villiers, SIX runs Boom. Biff. Thwack! He opened his stance up, taking his front foot well outside the line and slog swept it hard and the ball crashes against the scoreboard.
McGain to de Villiers, no run stop the press. It's a dot ball. On the legs, turned to the on side
McGain to de Villiers, no run quicker, shorter, flatter on the middle, AB backs away to cut hard but can't beat backward point
Siddle to Morkel, no run fullish, moving in to the middle and off, squeezed to midwicket
Siddle to Morkel, no run length delivery from round the stumps, defended to the off side
Siddle to Morkel, no run gets forward to drive to mid-on
Siddle to Morkel, no run leans forward to push it to left of Hussey
Siddle to Morkel, no run banged in short, from round the stumps, Albie goes for the pull and is hit on the body
Siddle to Morkel, no run moving in towards middle and off from that angle, pushed to the off side
McDonald to de Villiers, SIX runs wow! What a stunning hit. Clobbered that. It was not all that short but AB just swung it over deep midwicket. He flayed that.
McDonald to de Villiers, SIX runs McDonald helps AB by pitching this one even shorter and de Villiers says thanks for the gift and rips it to the crowd behind deep midwicket. up up and over.
McDonald to de Villiers, SIX runs Murder! Full pitched this time and AB kills it over long-on. Lovely clean swing of the bat. Will he keep going for sixes?

McDonald to de Villiers, SIX runs Oh boy What is happening out there? AB keeps going for his flamboyant shots and keeps pulling em off. Whaddaaplayaaa! Full in length and he holds his balance, stands still and hammers it over cowcorner. Now then Now then..
McDonald to de Villiers, 1 run AB charges down the track, looking for the fifth six, McDonald fires it in the blockhole and AB ends up digging out. That's that, then.

McDonald to Morkel, OUT And a wicket to end the over where AB smoked 4 sixes. It landed on a length around middle and leg and moved towards middle and off, Albie had a lazy waft at it, missed it completely and was cleaned up. Not an attacking shot, just a defensive waft
Siddle to de Villiers, no run full and outside off stump, left alone
Siddle to de Villiers, no run moving in towards the off, defended to the off side
Siddle to de Villiers, 2 runs short in length, that wristy swat-pull fetches him a single to deep square leg. er .. he takes two runs.
Siddle to de Villiers, 1 run leans across to square drive through cover point for another couple of runs
Siddle to Harris, no run dug in short, Harris shapes to fend it away but sees the ball is bouncing more than he thinks and sways away towards the off side and the ball flies over his left shoulder
Siddle to Harris, no run the inswinging yorker, Harris is on the back foot and does well to dig it out
McDonald to de Villiers, 1 run really full delivery, pushed through the on side
McDonald to Harris, 2 runs gets forward to stab it off the outer edge past gully
McDonald to Harris, no run looks to defend a delivery outside off but the ball straightens to move past the outside edge

McDonald to Harris, FOUR runs drifts to the pads, tickled away to fine-leg where Siddle puts in a sliding effort to stop the ball..which bounds off his body and he grabs at it while getting up but ends up palming it over the ropes
McDonald to Harris, 1 run flicked to Siddle for a single
McDonald to de Villiers, no run slower one, slipping down leg, misses the flick and Haddin moves to his left to take it
Siddle to Harris, 1 run goes back to push it to cover point
Siddle to de Villiers, 1 run square drives on a bent knee to Clare who is patrolling the boundary on the off side
Siddle to Harris, no run banged in short and it flies over the left shoulder
Siddle to Harris, no run another one dug in short, it doesn't climb as high as the previous one and Harris stands tall to push it to the off side
Siddle to Harris, 1 leg bye aiming for the rib cage, Harris shuffles across to fend it away off his body to fine-leg
Siddle to de Villiers, no run slightly short and outside off, AB goes for the big cut shot but the ball flies over the blade
McDonald to Harris, no run gets forward to push a full delivery to mid-on
McDonald to Harris, no run length delivery coming in, pushing to the on side of the pitch
McDonald to Harris, no run yorker on the middle and off line, jabbed away to the off side
McDonald to Harris, no run moves forward to drive to cover
McDonald to Harris, no run gentle seam-up stuff, eased to the off side
McDonald to Harris, no run shaping in from outside off, Harris shuffles across to defend
Johnson to de Villiers, no run shuffles across, drives a full delivery but straight to covers where Katich stops
Johnson to de Villiers, no run back of length, holding its line on the off stump line, hops back to defend to the off side
Johnson to de Villiers, 1 run full pitched outside off, de Villiers is late in coming forward, lunges out to drive wide of mid-off for a single
Johnson to Harris, no run short leg and leg gully watch as Harris shuffles across, expecting a bouncer and ends up beaten by a full delivery outside off
Johnson to Harris, no run pretty full and outside off, left alone
Johnson to Harris, no run the bouncer arrives and Harris ducks and moves away to the off side to get away from it
McDonald to de Villiers, 1 run full toss on the leg stump line, jabbed to square leg
McDonald to Harris, 1 run full pitched on legs, flicked away past square leg for a single

McDonald to de Villiers, FOUR runs 150 up with a big golf swing. It was full and straight, AB cleared the front foot and got under the ball too much and gets more elevation than distance but still enough meat to clear mid-on and it rolls over to the boundary. The crowd go mad.
McDonald to de Villiers, no run punches to Ponting at midwicket
McDonald to de Villiers, 1 run leans forward to caress a full delivery to left of long-on
McDonald to Harris, no run shuffles across, is struck on the pad outside off stump or did he edge it , not sure, and bounds away to gully
Johnson to de Villiers, 1 run full pitched outside off stump, bends his knee to slice it away to Clarke at deep point
Johnson to Harris, 1 wide from round the stumps, hurls a wide delivery outside off stump. The extras keep piling up.
Johnson to Harris, no run lands well outside off stump, left alone
Johnson to Harris, 2 runs full and wide again, Harris reaches out to steer it past backward point and Hussey rushes after it to pull it back from the ropes
Johnson to Harris, no run full and on the off stump line, still from round the stumps, nudged to the off side
Johnson to Harris, no run goes well back to get behind the line of a short-of-length delivery and defends it back to Mitch
Johnson to Harris, 1 run slips down leg and Harris retains the strike with a flick to fine-leg
McDonald to Harris, no run leans forward to defend to the off side
McDonald to Harris, no run cant rotate the strike, another dab to cover
McDonald to Harris, no run leans forward to push it back to the bowler
McDonald to Harris, 1 leg bye yorker ,drifting outside leg and off the pad to fine leg. AB is on strike.
McDonald to de Villiers, FOUR runs moves outside leg and thrashes a full delivery inside out through wide mid-off. That's South Africa's highest score against Australia
McDonald to de Villiers, 1 run driven to mid-on
Johnson to de Villiers, 4 leg byes banged in short, at the body, de Villiers swivels to lap it around the corner, guess it ran off his body to fine-leg boundary
Johnson to de Villiers, no run outside off ,guided to point region
Johnson to de Villiers, 1 run short and wide, stops a bit on AB who reaches out to check the cut shot
Johnson to Harris, 1 run shufles across to work it past midwicket
Johnson to de Villiers, 1 run he is doing what he wants really. this was not even short but AB plays that wristy swat pull to deep midwicket
Johnson to Harris, no run cutting away past the poke and to Haddin.
Katich to de Villiers, 1 run shortish delivery outside off, cut away to deep point
Katich to Harris, no run turning in from outside off, pushed to cover

Katich to Harris, no run low flighted dipping full toss, Harris shapes to paddle it and is hit on the pad. Loud loud shout and Bucknor waits before giving it out. Harris asks for the review. It hit him outside off stump. So that can't be given out as he was playing a shot. Not out is the verdict.
Katich to Harris, no run goes back to punch the sliding delivery to cover
Katich to Harris, FOUR runs flighted across and Harris deciders to indulge himself. He goes for the sweep and top edges it well clear of backward square leg and to the boundary
Katich to Harris, no run slides away outside off stump, Harris pushes inside the line and is beaten. Is this the best 150th over in Test history?!
Johnson to de Villiers, no run full pitched outside off, driven to cover
Johnson to de Villiers, no run short in length, on the off stump, tries to whip it away but ends up sending it towards mid-on
Johnson to de Villiers, 1 leg bye short in length, at the body, mistimes the pull to short fine-leg region
Johnson to Harris, no run the bouncer, Harris takes his eyes off the ball, ducks and the ball flies off his back to Haddin
Johnson to Harris, no run cutting away from Harris who opens up his stance to defend to the off side
Johnson to Harris, no run fuller, on the off and middle, pushed down to mid-on
Katich to de Villiers, no run comes charging down the track, Katich keeps his calm and drags back the length and jabbed away to the on side

Katich to de Villiers, OUT AB has holed out to deep midwicket. Short delivery, nothing special, could have disappeared out of the ground but AB pulls it straight to the fielder. What a fine entertaining innings from de Villiers. The crowd loved it and are now showing their appreciation with a generous th
Katich to Steyn, no run leans forward to drive it back to the bowler
Katich to Steyn, no run fuller, flatter, outside off, wristed to the leg side
Katich to Steyn, no run flighted full outside off, driven to cover

Katich to Steyn, OUT Lovely loopy slider from Katich who picks his second wicket. It looped up outside off, good rip on the ball and Steyn drove inside the line and edged it to slip. Questions will be asked why Ponting didn't bring Kato on earlier. Was the bowler reluctant or the captain? Press conferenc
Johnson to Harris, no run from round the stumps, full and outside off, Harris goes for the big drive and misses

Johnson to Harris, no run dropped by Ponting diving to his right at second slip. Full pitched and well outside the off stump, Harris' feet were glued to each other, the bat was hung out and the ball flew to Ponting who dived but couldn't hold on
Johnson to Harris, no run
Johnson to Harris, no run overpitched outside off but Harris is on the back foot and ends up stabbing it to the off side
Johnson to Harris, FOUR runs Whoa! Harris decides to have some fun. He cleared the front foot and swung a length delivery over midwicket.
Johnson to Harris, no run moves outside leg stump, Mitch keeps it full and outside off, Harris goes for the slice drive on a bent knee but can't connect
Katich to Ntini, no run goes back to push to the off side
Katich to Ntini, no run flighted delivery outside off, driven to mid-on
Katich to Ntini, no run leans across to steer to backward point
Katich to Ntini, no run turns in to beat the defensive poke and hits high on the pad, going down leg, i guess
Katich to Ntini, FOUR runs drags this short and Ntini goes back to cut it hard and gets it through the off-side field
Katich to Ntini, no run flighted full on the off stump line, pushed to the off side
Johnson to Harris, 2 runs backs away to the leg side, Mitch fires it full, almost a yorker, on the off stump, Harris reaches out to chop it through covers
Johnson to Harris, FOUR runs oh dear! he has almost decapitated Asad Rauf! He moved outside leg and hammered a full delivery past the startled bowler and the shocked umpire!

So South Africa all out for 651. They lead by 442. A mountain to climb. AB indulged himself, Albie had fun and even Harris threw his bat around. Much fun for the crowd. That's tea as well. Join us in a while for the final session.
South Africa won by an innings and 20 runs
Player of the match is Paul Harris, SA
